Reviews.Title: “Roma Fiera”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fairly good in many terms. But the breakfast was very limited and basic, you are ın Italy and there's no olive in breakfast! And moreover the dishes were put immediately after being taken from the dishwasher,without checked, so we were to see the dirt on them. The reception staff was helpful and kind, the rooms were clean . Stay here but eat out!

Reviews.Title: “A different Ibis Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojolayon
Reviews.Content: I chose Ibis Hotel during my Euro tour last November (I stayed in 5 different Ibis Hotels). In this hotel, the food was great, the staff were courteous and helpful, the room size was just right but the bed, which was supposed to be a twin-sized bed, was actually a two (2) single-sized bed joined together. The beds moved apart when I positioned myself centrally, it will be too small for me if i'll stay on one side, so I requested for a "real" twin-sized bed but the staff, who was so honest, informed me that they don't have a "twin-sized bed".

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Free internet in the room should be provided. Even if the cost of internet is included in the room rent. Having to buy internet at counter makes it little strange feeling. Apart from that, the service was excellent, very helpful and co-operative employees.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and staff but no actual shuttle service to/from airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had to be in Civitavecchia the next day but I chose to stay at this hotel near Fiumicino airport simply because I normally use the Ibis group and am 100% satisfied with them. They are much more comfortable and reliable than some unknown local hotels. The only drawback with this one is that it lies about 7 miles from the airport and there is no public transport and taxis in Rome are very expensive as 7 miles cost approx Eur 25.00 I wish they had their own shuttle and I wouldn't mind to pay like Eur 10 o/w to use it.

Reviews.Title: “far away from downtown”
Reviews.Author: FredericoHeinzmann
Reviews.Content: we try to go back by subway+train to these hotel....don´t do that, it´s dangerouse and you will spend at least 2 hours. it´s far away from Rome downtown and taxi is expensive, try another hotel next to the subway. This hotel is good just if you have a car...

Reviews.Title: “Functional not Fancy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 15-20 minutes drive from the airport in a barren grubby suburb surrounded by farm land. Next door are several shops including basic eateries and a groceries store. There is a shuttle bus to the airport that is not mentioned on their website and its schedule is uncertain. It came from the nearby Marriott and picked us up half an hour later than expected. Our room was comfortable once the airconditioning was switched on at 3pm (it goes off around 8am). The beds were good. I can't remember finding an English TV channel other than the news, which repeated ad nauseam. There is no tea or coffee making or refrigerator in the room. Both cable and WiFi Internet connections are available for a fee. Toiletries and tissues are not supplied: the supplied bath gel is meant to also shampoo and condition. There is small restaurant and bar in the foyer, but don't expect many of the menu items to be available: they had no meat at all the night we ate there and the listed beer was available either. Nevertheless, the food served was okay, rather than gourmet.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for small money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel, as we were leaving from Fiumicino the next day. We found the room very good and the service was also very good. The only bad thing about the hotel was a very ugly smell from some part of the drainage.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but location wise bad for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: KBadri
Reviews.Content: If you get good rates for this hotel, it is worth to consider. But beware the transportation is terrible and you might spend more than 1 hour to commute to the city one way. Service from hotel staff was average. The reception staff wasnt very warm and friendly - especially the night shift ones.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location was good ,the room was clean .it was wait on the outside. but needs friendly front desk on the morning stuff only. Ibis Hotel will always be my second home when we travel Europe ,after Rome every Ibis was excellent. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: rooms need small refrigerators, staff was friendly and professional, car parking space is ok and location is perfect. in other words i would recommend this hotel to a friend of mine. ibis is stable value among hotels without spending a small thesaurous

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In general my experience was nice because the service, the place and the location. Thus, I would recommend this hotel to my friends. Also, the bus service to the city was very comfortable. I just heard some complains from other costumers about the mosquitos, but I did not have any trouble at all and I really enjoyed my experience at the hote..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with interiors but staff is bit rude towards non italian tourists”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: i came late in the evenings exhausted from a long travel, staff was busy so i waited,they seemed very rude when i asked for cash point as my card was not working, they seemed more interested in getting the payment,it would have been nice to allocate me a room so tht i cud have a rest and then go n get the remaining cash. They don't seem to trust if you don't speak italian, for almost everything from takin internet card to ordering a cab to enabling the telephone line you have to come down. Hotel is also very remote, when i requested for details on how to travel around,they just looked disillusioned n not interested. One of the staff told me nearest station is just 1Km n only way is to walk there or take a cab, in sweltering heat i walked a few times later to know that their is a bus no.23 right out of hotel. Ambience n rooms n room service r very nice, even late nite services r excellent.Only if staff wud been nice n informative, i would have recommended it highly

Reviews.Title: “Hotel´s services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 1) The air conditioning system was not working. I complained to an employee (Vincenzo) and he said that the system was working normally (????). Later I complained again to another employee and he told me that the system was turned off!!!!!!!! I supposed that the hotel needs to save money... 2) The internet was not working as well. 3) I asked Vincenzo how to get to downtown. He said that I could walk until the train station for 5 minutes only 500 meters, or take the bus which passes every 20 minutes. Indeed, the distance is 1,5 KM and the bus passes every 50 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “"In medio stat virtus" but not in this case.”
Reviews.Author: Anxanum
Reviews.Content: Typical IBIS standard with decent rooms and acceptable level of cleanliness. It is a good compromise of price and quality but the position, as stated in the title, is not optimal to visit Rome or to reach Fiumicino or Cimapino airports. There is not shuttle available and connections with Rome center is a disaster. If you have to go to the Airport you got to take a Taxi and it costs too much. In this case I better suggest to find a closer Hotel to airport more expensive but combining IBIS price and Taxi cost it will be the same.

Reviews.Title: “ibisrome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is far from center rome, breakfast is lousy with not much veriety, it is like self service hotel, i guest this is what you get when travel to western countries no service, no smiles no vulue for money.

Reviews.Title: “The worst service from all Ibis hotels I have visited!”
Reviews.Author: Teodor_Petkov Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am frequent guest of Accor Hotels and Ibis in particular. I can say that this hotel in Rome have the worst staff of all I have been to. The hotel in general is covering the standards of regular Ibis hotel, but the attitude of the staff, especially at the reception was unacceptable! If I did not paid in advance I definately won't stay there. Terrible and arrogant attitude of the reception staff to customers. Some of the staff barely spoke English. We had no Hello or Goodbuy upon arrival/departure, no thank you or something like this - I experiance this kind of attitude for first time and I travel a lot! In general I will recommend Ibis chain to everybody, but not this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't have a car? Look for another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Katinams Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I should have done more research before booking this hotel, but it said on their site that it is "at the airport" and as I had a morning flight back to Amsterdam it sounded good to me. I called the hotel to get instructions on how to get there and even though it sounded a bit out of the way, it was not until I arrived that I realised that you really need your own car. A taxi to the airport (12 km) will knock you back 35 Euro and the hotel only has limited shuttle service with the first shuttle at 8 a.m. The local bus that could take you to the nearby train station apparently only runs every 50 minutes and I could not find a time table anywhere. You could walk the 1.5 km to the train station, but there is no foot path and quite a busy road. So, taxi it was. The hotel itself could do with some fresh paint and fresh grit & silicone in the bathroom, but my biggest disappointment was with the shower producing nothing more than a trickle of water. It was early and I was in a hurry to get to the airport, or I would have asked for a new room so I could finish washing my hair. As it went, I had to rinse my hair in the bathroom sink instead (which had water). On the good note, all the staff was very helpful and friendly. Just a shame about the rest - lesson learned and I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll need a car”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good. It's brand new, clean and worth the price, I like Ibis' standard very much. The biggest problem of this unit is its location: unless you are so patient, not in a hurry, you will need a car, because there is just one bus line, and sometimes you'll need to wait up to 45 minutes until the bus comes (or walk 20 minutes to reach the train station - but the road is not so good, specially at night). After that, you will need to take a train to Rome, that sometimes is late, so it's going to consume up to 60 minutes to reach a subway station). Off course, you have the option to pay for a shuttle trip to the center of Rome, but the first leaves just at 9:45AM. Concerning the breakfast, it's not worthy the price, there are no fruits and no local cheeses - usually Ibis units serve these local items.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: CEBV
Reviews.Content: The Ibis chain can guarantee decent rooms at a decent price. However the staff was really, really rude. I know Italians are not very keen to good service but the people in this hotel were just too much.

Reviews.Title: “far far away in a distant galaxy”
Reviews.Author: FedeF
Reviews.Content: good hotel if you have a car. The hotel i generally clean and quiet. Rooms have the standard Ibis layout, no surprise. Usually cheap then the average in Rome for the quality of the rooms, probably because of the distance to downtown. There is a train stop nearby (2km) but you have to take a bus to go there

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Poor location: Not well connected to the city Rude Staff: First they dont understand English / They dont want to try to find out what you want / Even answering a simple query is considered a big favour from their end / Not at all suggestive for a tourist looking for an economic hotel Bad Breakfast: The selection of items for the breakfast was very limited and again the staff at the counter doesnt even care to replace items in the buffet breakfast Overall: Very dissatisfied with the money I spent on this hotel and consider my vacation spoilt because of a bad choice in selecting this place

Reviews.Title: “I do not recomand”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and the hotel overall is OK, but the breakfast is a joke. Only one person served and cooked and cleaned and do everithing. It was a huge chaos. The meal was chees and ham (if you ever got), tea if you find any hot water and bread if it was made. It was a lot of mess in the dining room. The hotel is far far away from the City Center (3 bus station - if the bus comes and I do not recomand the walking because of the neighborhood; plus train plus subway).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: easy to find location, not far from the airport. One drawback of the location - getting out of the hotel and into Via dela Magliana is quite dangerous with hardly any left-side visibility and cars coming at high speeds from there. A convex mirror is needed there!. Nearest restaurant is 1Km and very good. ATM very close. Staff was very nice and very helpful. Our room faced the main road and the rail but windows have excellent insulation and sleep was very sound. The room was very clean and the mattress very good and firm, as we like it. The biggest disadvantage (and maybe the only one we see) is no wi-fi in the rooms but we were told by the staff that free wi-fi is being installed and will be available soon. Overall- an excellent choice we made and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and price”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good combination of very reasonable rates and proximity to the airport for an early flight back to New York. Spacious room but somewhat noisy if you opened the windows. We faced the train tracks and the highway.

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE TO FUMICINO AIRPORT ROME”
Reviews.Author: happymanTelford Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL is a FEW MINUTES DRIVE from ROME'S FUMICINO AIRPORT. AFTER a tiring flight we were so quickly to our hotel, where we were greeted in an EFFICIENT AND FRIENDLY MANNER. After a good nights sleep we were able to set out fully refreshed. EXCELLENT VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “Normal Accor / Ibis quality, but VERY expensive 'extras' and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay with Accor hotels quite a few times throughout the year, and this hotel had the highest internet charges and least friendly staff I've ever received. They weren't rude per se, but were short and unhelpful. I suspect that this may be due to the negative feedback that they must receive about the outrageous internet charges and also the car parking situation. Hotel was normal by Accor standards - easy to find, clean and just what would be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent stay in IBIS magliana”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After a long journey and in our final destination Roma, we wanted a good place to stay. Thanks Accor hotels (IBIS roma Magliana). we enjoyed to stay there. One problem we faced, to go from Muratella station to IBIS hotel, there is no conveyance, apart from 23 BUS , having frequency of 1 hour, but not fixed. Rest everything was superb. Thanks Accor hotels for our pleasent stay in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Far from Downtown and once you make reservation no way back to cancel it!!”
Reviews.Author: estanoche1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Travelers behave once I made the resevation in a very quick decision than I realised it is so hard to travel down town rome back and fort like 25 to 30 euro each way menas additional 60 euro back and fort if I calculate my stay for 3 days thats additional 189 euro just for cab ride!!!! Than I called the hotel reservation ask them if I can cancel my reservation they said according the way you paid in advance for couple months advance booking you can not cancel your reservaton...!!!! That was the shock moment I have not heard such thing in Hotel life in my life , according to my worldwide hotle experience this is disaster....So hotel management beware....and be nor eflexable with you cancellation policies , it should not be a great favor done by you simply giving discount for a low season , your customers should be able to cancel any reservation days advance just like they made it days advance....So does not make sense to me no cancellition possibilities..... At this point i got 2 options one forget about this hotel , second make another reservation and go somehwere more close to downtown Rome.... Ciao IBIS Hotels.......... I am not happy and will never suggest anyone about IBIS hotels.... sorry

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great coffee!”
Reviews.Author: greenfeet4 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: After some of the previous reviews I was a bit wary, but this hotel was great for the price! Location Isn't the best, if you're planning on going in and out of the centre of Rome, but we were going to a family wedding and it was better to be in the outskirts. There is a shuttle to the centre, but I didn't take it, so don't know what it's like. The breakfast is better than I expected - cake, cold meats, bread, cereal, yoghurts, cereals etc. The coffee machine is great!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, no air conditioning at night, expensive unreliable wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: goldenstater
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at the Marriott. They were booked up, so we stayed at the Ibis, which is about a 15-minute walk through a strange landscape of new apartment buildings, office parks, and vacant lots. The good: decent room, lobby bar open 24/7 (you can also get food at the cafe, though we bought pizza across the street), clean, modern style. Given our need to be near the Marriott, the Ibis was a much better choice than the Sheraton, which you can't walk from. The bad: The hotel turns the air conditioning off at night, which is when you need it. There is no fan and no airflow across the room unless you prop the door open--not an option while you're sleeping. The wi-fi is expensive and didn't work reliably. We wound up buying a USB "key" from TIM with pay-as-you-go wireless access. (This requires a trip into town. There's a TIM store at the Termini station, where we also bought SIM cards for a couple of unlocked phones.) As many reviewers have noted, the hotel really is in the middle of nowhere, neither in town nor at the airport. To get to town, we took the bus from the Marriott, which runs every two hours. Buy tickets from the concierge. Despite what you may think from the map, the train station is not within walking distance (defined as less than 1.5 miles), because you can't cross the tracks. (Try Google pedestrian directions to see the problem.) Bottom line: If you need an alternative to the Marriott conference center, this is your best bet. Otherwise, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel too far from Rome central to justify cheaper prices”
Reviews.Author: kiwibelair Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is too far from sights in Rome, with a very expensive shuttle service. staff were unhelpful, and pushed the bus/train combo to get into Rome, but it was too difficult and time consuming to use. The rooms were not cleaned satisfactorily, with hairs in our shower on arrival. Complaints about this elicited a free breakfast the next morning, but subsequent cleaning was also substandard. Internet access is charged for, even though every other Ibis Hotel in both france and Italy was free or complimentary time each day.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this hotel. Staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: robbo74Mid Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Being close to the new Fiera di Roma the hotel has set good standards for the many different nationalities of people who stay here. Staff very helpful and gave good, attentive service. Slight noise problem for those with a room overlooking the road system and who like to have some fresh air rather than constant AV.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel did not respond to any expectations”
Reviews.Author: AntonioNiteroi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The restaurant has bad food, the wine came after the food and already open. The air conditioning does not work at night, being forced to sleep with the windows opened. The last day was paid, but no room service for this and i had to get towels from reception. The room was already locked for use with my luggage still inside, as if we were not over use it, despite being paid one more day. The transfer from the center to the hotel was scheduled in advance to 23:30, but the hotel has forgotten to schedule it with the company contracted and we had to take a taxi after waiting a long time.

Reviews.Title: “terrible stay experience in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samkk_10 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: location is too far away of downtown for visitor. transportation is far away of hotel. do not have fee internet access.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is good but the location is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Nana2305 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and confortable, The breakfast is also good. However, the location is terrible. You have to take a bus and a train to go to Rome. We wait more than one hour for the bus and there is only one bus to go to the train station of Muratella. Also, the staff of the hotel are not really helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel if you want to be close to the airport, not if you like the centre or service”
Reviews.Author: Janne_Rdam Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like any other Ibis, simple but fine. There were however a lot things that I did not like. The bed was really hard, luckily I had a double bed for myself, so I put the 2 mattresses on top of each other. Part of the staff was really friendly, but part was not.I had called to the hotel before how I could reach them, they told me to take a cab. When I came to the hotel I saw they also had a shuttle service, they had not told me about this... On the last night of my stay I came home late and my room had not been cleaned. I went down to reception, they said that I must have done something wrong (hanging the no disturb sign on my door). I told them I had not and that surprisingly I had 2 signs, hanging both on the inside and outside of my door. Something I could not have done. They stuck to the fact that I made a mistake, I did not get an apology and after much ado the only thing they offered was to clean my room, but than I had to wait before being able to sleep. Bad service! Luckily there also were some nice people at reception that should be mentioned. At check in they were really helpful and friendly! The breakfast was good, with croissants and everything. The dinner in the hotel however is an insult to Italian cuisine, my lasagna was microwaved. As more people have indicated the hotel is far out of the centre. You can take the hotel shuttle of 12 euro per ride (thus 24 for a return ride and only on set times), taking a cab will not be cheaper. The bus that goes past the hotel goes every 45 minutes (the hotel does not know the times). The train is doable and only 1 euro per ride, but to get there you have to walk on a road without sidewalk, where the cars drive really fast and where it is not safe in the evenings (I tried, it was really scary!). Thus if you look for a hotel for a city trip I do not recommend this. I had a business trip so I only went into the city twice. As a business hotel this is basic but fine. But don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet room with an honorable staff”
Reviews.Author: wildernessOne Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very basic, but clean, functional, and very quiet. In fact, the AC unit was so quiet you didn't even realize it was working. Most economy hotels, at least in the US, have loud obnoxious AC units in the room. In a rush to get to my conference, I accidentally left 110 euros on the desk one day. It was still there when I returned later that night. I was pleasantly surprised. The location is the biggest downer. You really need a car. Getting to the local train can be treacherous. There's no sidewalk. I didn't try it. However, I did the 10-15 minute walk to my conference at the Marriott up the hill. I as well as other conference attendees staying at the Ibis were startled by a few wild dogs you would pass on the walk to the Marriott. This was unnerving, but no incidents were reported. At first I was scared and later I just felt sorry for these abandoned dogs. Some folks would take a cab, but I continued to do the walk anyway. I was always cautious and very alert. I survived. :) Internet was 15 euro for 24 hours. That was disappointing. The breakfast for an extra 8.50 euro was OK. Nothing special. Compared to the main conference hotel, I saved tremendously by staying at the Ibis and so I cannot complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rkhannamumbai
Reviews.Content: As part of my business tour to Europe, stayed at this hotel.Got a very good last minute deal. The hotel is far from the city center.This was my first trip to Rome, so was not aware of location.But I must say that there is a train station near the hotel.One can get a bus from a nearby bus stop to the station A bit of hopping,but never mind it was not very difficult to get around.Being from Mumbai, it was not at all a problem. Breakfast was pretty good.We did not try any meals at the hotel.Instead we went to the nearby restaurant.Clean rooms.Staff were pretty efficient.Fast checkin and checkouts made life a lot easier.Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult access - but not expensive”
Reviews.Author: Andy_1950
Reviews.Content: The Ibis at Magliana is a potential choice when you need a hotel near Fiumicino Airport. However, it is not really near the airport. It is 1km from the train station at Muratella which served every 15mins by trains from the airport (journey time 10 mins). If you come from Rome centre the trains are from Ostiense (not Termini) so from Termini you have to change at Ostiense - but the fare is only .90c! The road from Muratella station to the hotel is busy and has no footpath - a 15min walk that is not recommended - especially at night. There is a bus (No23 I think) but you need to have bought a Rome bus ticket in advance - you cannot pay on the bus. If you call the hotel they will send a taxi for you - but this could take some time as taxis will not want such a short trip. So, how else can reach the hotel? There is a shuttle from the airport (12€) which has an infrequent time table - for example between 8am and 11am there are 4 shuttles from the airport and only 2 shuttles to the airport. A taxi from the airport is probably the best option but agree a fare before departing - it should be around 25-30€ - try not to get ripped off - only 50% of Rome taxi drivers are honest (statistic based on 10 years experience). As for the hotel, its a standard Ibis, quite clean and the usual good Accor service. Restaurant is nothing special - it closes at 10.30pm but get there before 10pm if you want to have the full menu choice. Rooms are clean and very quiet and the parking looks safe (big gates). If you haven't got a car, think hard before taking the train to get to the Ibis Magliana.

Reviews.Title: “quite and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WayanPai
Reviews.Content: Ibis Roma Magliana, 10 minutes by taxi to Fiumicino International Airport , If you choose to have better rest while in holiday, you could choose this hotel, good food, good service, easy access (by tramway & bus).

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel, but even ruder staff”
Reviews.Author: haconstruct
Reviews.Content: Just DO NOT stay here!!!! It is not at the airport, not near anything, not at Magliana but outside of town. There is no way to airport cept taxi, no way to hotel cept taxi no matter what they say! Staff would have to be much better just to be rude; no service, no help, and over all nasty. And was lied to about leaving a piece of luggage at the hotel overnight by hotel before booking (and they acknowledge that they lied) while on 1-day trip to Venice; Ibis was not able to speak to their own mgr so no resolution; had to add one move night @ USD96 just to have one piece of luggage remain in the hotel; and the hotel admits they told wrong info when I called but will not refund room charge. Ibis are usually pretty good deal for the money, but this one is not and I will NEVER stay at an Ibis again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Fercap
Reviews.Content: Nice people, excellent hotel for a Ibis. The train station is near you can take the car and park there or go by bus to the train. I recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good value, go there if you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: ZeCarneiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3days, 02 rooms, clean and spacious for a Ibis. A bit distant to the center ROme if you don't have a car. No restaurant's near the hotel, and the inside rest is simple. But is a good value to travel in family.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location, horrible service, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: meezomona
Reviews.Content: we wished we had paid more and gone to another hotel. This is the worst hotel I have been to in my life, and I travel a lot! First) dont believe the map they show on their website... it will take you an hour and a half minimum to get to the center. one must be suicidal to walk from the "Muratella Station"... no sidewalk, speedy cars, curvy road 2nd) horribly arrogant and unprofessional staff. 3rd) noisy, train passes by regularly We deffinately dont recommend this hotel to anyone. well, you have been warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare, that has not ended yet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce22Vancouver
Reviews.Content: In my 55 years of age, this has been the most irritating hotel experience I have ever had. Don't believe the map they have on their website. It shows the hotel just across from Muratella train station, maybe only five minutes far by walking. Well, it took us more than one hour to walk with luggage from the station to the hotel, and what an unpleasant walk! The road has no street light and no pedestrian sidewalk. So it is extremely dangerous as we had to share the dark and narrow road with fast driving cars and buses and trucks. We were wondering, why there isn't even some signage to tell us how far the hotel is?!!! Even when the hotel sign on top of a building came to sight, we were still far from relief. The next challenge was to find the entrance which is well hidden on a back street. Again, no signage to easily lead us there, and we had to find the gate to this jem by several times walking around the block and asking from a passer by. We stayed only one night in there, and we paid for it the next day when we were checking out. But a month later, I learned from my Credit Card statement that they have charged me for 6 more nights!!! When I called they told me that I had made a reservation for 7 nights and that reservation could not have been cancelled. But the manager on the phone couldn't explain why they haven't told me this at the check-out time...why they did't get my signed authorization for the extra charge at that time...and why the receptionist explicitly confirmed that the reservation had been cancelled!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Mika7275
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first night in Rome in this hotel because of a late flight and reasonable price (double room 70 eur including the breakfast). Taxi from Fiumicino airport takes only 10 minute and cost 30 eur. The hotel is quite new and very clean. The location is in the middle of nowhere but if you know that it is not a big problem. It is very good hotel for passage travellers. The buffet breakfast was unexpected good. Taxi to the town centre cost 40 eur and takes about one our.

Reviews.Title: “No way, Josè”
Reviews.Author: Lag2
Reviews.Content: I'm italian, so I didn't have any problem with the staff, no misunderstandings, no language troubles, but: apart from being a brand new and extra-clean building, this hotel has to be avoided from the very start. I just needed a place to sleep during my stay for work reasons ( 5 working days in the near "Nuova Fiera di Roma") and I thought it would be perfect as it claimed to be "near the train station" on the line that links Rome airport to the city. It's near indeed, but if you have to walk to the station, maybe bringing some luggage with you, it's a chess game with death. The distance of about 1 Km is covered by a really busy and fast road, full of speeding lorries, coaches, tractors, you name it. The road has very little or no room at all for pedestrians (it wasn't meant to be a road to walk along) and it's full of dirt. Don't even think about walking on it in the night (no lighs) or in rain (mud everywhere). At last, if you're lucky enough to reach the station, you'll find it crowded with beggars and gypsies who are living in a camp nearby. Back to the hotel, service is average and food is less than average. What's worst, there's *nothing* around at walking distance, just a cafè and a small discount supermarket. If you don't have a car stay away from this hotel, and if you have it, choose another one, because that dirty busy road is the only way to Rome and it's definately not a pleasure to drive on it.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value”
Reviews.Author: worktotravel025
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fairly new but lacked amenities, no fridge, kettle, room service etc. Staff were not very pleasant either Terrible location not really close to airport or train stayion

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms but BAD Location”
Reviews.Author: inferno16978
Reviews.Content: The exterior as well as the interiors are pretty good, however the location of the Hotel is terrible if u plan to see the wonderful city of Rome. The hotel is very close to airport, but very far from main city. Even the closest railway station is a good approx 2 Kms walk & the bus service from train station is also very infrequent. Also if you are partyinglate in the city & plan to come late to the hotel - I would suggest you to avoid this hotel. The only good part of this hotel is its room & decor. The staff is also ok - nothing very great. Language is a big problem with the staff as except one staff - no one knows even barely passable english.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: Sballb
Reviews.Content: Be very wary of this hotel. According to the website it is 5 mins from Aiport. This is untrue, even the staff admitted this. The hotel is located on a treacherous backroad about 1.5 miles from the nearest station. Its about 30mins from Airport by train then there is a 20min walk to the hotel on a very dangerous road. To go to the city is an ordeal too. You must walk to the station along the same road and get a train three stops, transfer there to the metro and the get a bus to the city. Very confusing and long. Rooms were nice and cozy however staff were unfriendly and clueless to tourists. Many people complained during my stay, mostly about the distance and misleading information on the website. Be advised. Go to a hotel in town and save the 40E a day on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “a transfer sould be a must”
Reviews.Author: baleal
Reviews.Content: when i make the reservation i saw the map, and realize that hotel was near the station muratella, but it was too far away, and the road was too dangerouse, the bus line 32 was most inefficient, 1 bus per hr. there sould be a transfer bus from the hotel to the station, basically because the hotel area was under construction, even the ibis name on green letters was covered, impossible to see at night. i was charged for a extra bed for my sister daughter* age 12. nevertheless the hotel was ok, the rooms extremely clean. and brand new, and the staff was wonderfull . jorge bruno

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ella_Trip
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and clean, comfortable. The staff wasnt exactly the most friendly I've ever seen. For breakfast expect to have a lot of sweet stuff: fruit, fresh juice, milk and cereals, cookies, pastry, fruit salad, jam, honey, and some of their specific ham and cheese. We checked in late at night, around 2 o'clock so I have to admit they were really understanding. Prices are really good comparing to other hotels. We had no problem with the location as we were there to visit Fiera Roma which is quite close. But if you want to get downtown you sure have to drive a lot. Ella, Romania

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, Enormously expensive to get to the Airport!”
Reviews.Author: Lynne.Charlie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was inexpensive but new, kinda like a Motel 6; however, while it is close to the airport, the taxis are dispatched from Rome and you pay from the time they take the call until they pick you up and drop you at the airport - so, you pay a fortune to get to the hotel (so you're close to the airport) and then you pay a fortune to get transported to the airport. The only alternative is to haul your stuff to the train station near the hotel - which is at least 1/2 mile away. Stay in Rome, take the train to the airport - save a ton of money and you'll also have places to go to eat....
